title: Using 1 as shutdown port with Windows service works, but prints error message
description: Specify <Server port="1" in server.xml3. That can be used to differentiate the two use cases.There could be improvements on how to stop Tomcat. System.exit(0) would work regardless of all that.I suppose that jsvc may show the same behaviour, but I have not tried.
OB: When using 1 as the shutdown port with a Windows service running Tomcat, it works but also prints an error message in the catalina.20100427.log file. The error message is: 'No shutdown port configured. Server not shut down.' Despite the error message, Tomcat actually stops successfully with System.exit(1) being called by Catalina.stopServer(). When the service launcher stops Tomcat, Catalina.server is not null.
EB: The error message 'No shutdown port configured. Server not shut down.' should not be printed when using 1 as the shutdown port with a Windows service running Tomcat.
SR:
1. Install and run Tomcat as a Windows service.
2. Specify <Server port="1" in the server.xml file.
3. Observe the catalina.20100427.log file to see if the error message 'No shutdown port configured. Server not shut down.' is printed when stopping the Tomcat service.
